_exec_summary.SummaryText:
THE ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND EMERGENCY ACTION POLICIES AT THIS FACILITY.  This facility complies with Wisconsin Comm 43 for ammonia storage, and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws.  If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to contact the Johnson Creek Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.

A DESCRIPTION OF THE FACILITY AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED.  This facility is a farm cooperative.  We store and provide for application, anhydrous ammonia, dry fertilizers, and several dry and liquid pesticides.  The anhydrous ammonia system consists of one 12,000 gallon tank.  The ammonia is supplied by the vendor's bulk tanker, and is used to fill nurse tanks.  The nurse tank filling procedure is performed by our own employees.                                                                                                                             

THE WORST-CASE AND ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIOS.  Per the EPA requirements, we performed a worst-case release scenario, and reviewed alternative release scenarois for a release of anhydrous ammonia from our storage tank.  The information was used to perform an off-site consequence analysis for both situations.  Descriptions of the worst-case and alternative release scenarios, and the results of the off-site consequence analysis for both are included in Section 2 of this document.                                                                                                                                                                       

THE GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS.  This facility complies with EPS's accident prevention rule and all applicable state and local codes and regulations.  The ammonia system is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with Wisconsin Comm 43.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY.  We have never had an accident involving anhydrous ammonia tha

t caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place.

THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM.  In the event of an emergency involving the ammonia system, it is our policy to notify the Johnson Creek Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY.  None.
